projects: [{'title': 'Rehabilitation of the "Sugar Belt" road network and other strategic roads (110km) in Belize', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}}, 'description': 'Improve physical access, communication and transportation efficiency through the rehabilitation of the "Sugar Belt" road network and other strategic roads in Belize. The rational for the rehabilitation of the road network of the sugar belt (Corozal and Orange Walk districts) is that Belize must ensure a high quality freight transport system that is able to deliver goods to market quickly and cost-effectively, while minimising impacts on the community and environment. The rehabilitation of the sugar cane road network will improve the transportation of cane to mill all year round, will foster physical access and communications for the rural population and will create an enabling environment for social and economic development, including inland tourism and other non-sugar related economic activities.
